Sentencas: A Pr-doping strategy was used to improve traditional strontium-doped lanthanum ferrite oxides for proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Evaluating the effect of Pr-doping on the performance of strontium-doped lanthanum ferrite cathodes for protonic SOFCs

Sentencas: Three different samples, La0.5Sr0.5FeO3-delta, La0.25Pr0.25Sr0.5FeO3-delta, and Pr0.5Sr0.5FeO3-delta,were successfully prepared.
Titulo: Evaluating the effect of Pr-doping on the performance of strontium-doped lanthanum ferrite cathodes for protonic SOFCs

Sentencas: The Pr content was shown to have an obvious influence on the hydration ability of the materials.
Titulo: Evaluating the effect of Pr-doping on the performance of strontium-doped lanthanum ferrite cathodes for protonic SOFCs

Sentencas: Hydration was improved at higher Pr-contents, suggesting a promising cathode performance.
Titulo: Evaluating the effect of Pr-doping on the performance of strontium-doped lanthanum ferrite cathodes for protonic SOFCs

Sentencas: However, the improved hydration ability did not always lead to an increased fuel cell performance, and it was found that the fuel cell performed best when an appropriate Pr-doping amount was used that resulted in a good compromise between protonic and oxygen-ion conduction.
Titulo: Evaluating the effect of Pr-doping on the performance of strontium-doped lanthanum ferrite cathodes for protonic SOFCs

Sentencas: As a result, the optimized composition La0.25Pr0.25Sr0.5FeO3-delta generated a high peak power density of 616 mW cm(-2 )and a low polarization resistance of 0.09 at Omega cm(2) at 700 degrees C, which is an encouraging performance for a traditional cathode material.
Titulo: Evaluating the effect of Pr-doping on the performance of strontium-doped lanthanum ferrite cathodes for protonic SOFCs
